section.heading: Direct Exclusion Through Fantasy Competition Operator.

para.text: An individual may request exclusion from fantasy competition play by submitting to the operator a self-exclusion request using a self-exclusion tool provided by the operator on its website.
An operator shall implement and prominently display procedures for players to self-exclude themselves.
Self-excluded persons may not collect a prize or recover a loss.
A request for self-exclusion from a fantasy competition may result in exclusion from other gaming platforms that the operator offers.
A request for exclusion submitted to an operator:
Is not a request to be placed on the Commission’s Voluntary Exclusion List for participating in fantasy competitions under COMAR 36.01.03;
Will not result in inclusion on the Commission's Voluntary Exclusion List for participating in fantasy competitions; and
Is not administered or maintained by the Commission.
An operator shall establish a responsible gaming plan that includes at least the following elements:
Goals;
Procedures and deadlines for implementation;
Identification of personnel responsible for implementation;
Responsibilities of personnel identified as responsible for implementation;
Training for personnel on problem gambling and identifying compulsive play;
Means of educating fantasy competition players about:
Problem gambling, including compulsive play; and
Problem gambling treatment resources, including treatment and prevention programs;
Placement of responsible gambling awareness materials on the fantasy competition platform; and
Any other element required by the Commission.
An operator shall submit to the Commission the responsible gaming plan required under §A of this regulation for review and approval.
An operator shall submit any amendments to a responsible gaming plan to the Commission prior to implementation.
An operator shall submit to the Commission an annual report describing the operation of the responsible gaming plan.
An operator shall:
Prevent the participation in fantasy competitions by individuals who have self-excluded themselves from participating in a fantasy competition; and
Train employees on compulsive play.
If an individual is directly self-excluded or on the Commission’s Voluntary Exclusion List for fantasy competition play, an operator may not:
Market a fantasy competition by phone, text, email; or
Knowingly direct any form of individually targeted advertisement or marketing material to the individual.
